intro: Dimerostemma indutum, commonly known as the woolly dimerostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
